thread.title: Western Sahara: Canarian Workers Trade Union Condemns Moroccan 'Brutal' Repression Against Saharawi Population
thread.title_full: Western Sahara: Canarian Workers Trade Union Condemns Moroccan 'Brutal' Repression Against Saharawi Population

title: Western Sahara: Canarian Workers Trade Union Condemns Moroccan 'Brutal' Repression Against Saharawi Population
text:
Kenya: Obama Not to Discuss Homosexuality During Visit 
Candelaria — The Canarian Workers Trade Union condemned Friday in a resolution adopted by the VIII Congress held from 3 to 4 July in Candelaria, Tenerife, the "brutal" repression exercised by Morocco against the Saharawi population in the occupied territories of Western Sahara. 
The Congress also called on the international community, particularly the Spanish government, to stop the grave violations and repression to which the Saharawi citizens are subjected by "Moroccan despotic and tyrannical regime." 
"We sympathize with the Saharawi mother Tekbar Heddi in her struggle to recover the body of his son" killed by Moroccan thugs. 
Canarian Workers Trade Union expressed its commitment to defend the right of the Saharawi people to self-determination and independence. SPS Western Sahara
